content: is there such a thing as  image stacking to remove unwanted features (eg cars on a road)?

Yes, image stacking techniques can be used to remove or reduce unwanted features in an image, such as cars on a road. Image stacking involves taking multiple images of the same scene and combining them to create a final image with improved quality or specific features. By aligning the images and blending them together, it is possible to remove elements that are inconsistent across the different frames, such as moving objects like cars.

One common application of this technique is in astrophotography, where multiple images of the night sky are stacked to reduce noise, enhance details, and remove unwanted elements like passing airplanes or satellites. However, image stacking can also be used in other areas of photography or image processing to achieve similar effects.
